a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Statin use vs death rate from cardiovascular diseases, 2019
The use of statins in the population, measured in Defined Daily Doses per 1,000 people. This is compared to the
reported annual death rate from cardiovascular diseases per 100,000 people, based on the underlying cause
Data source: Guadamuz, Shooshtari and Qato (2022); WHO Mortality Database (2024)
Note: To allow for comparisons between countries and over time, the metrics are age-standardized. Statin use was estimated from
purchases by stores and hospitals and, in special cases like the United Kingdom, data on prescriptions for patients. All deaths in a
country may not have been registered with a cause of death.
